text: Joanna McCallum (born 27 June 1950)https://www.myheritage.com/research/record-10182-402942/joanna-mccallum- in-biographical-summaries-of-notable-people is an English theatre, film and television actress. She is the daughter of English actress Googie Withers and Australian actor John McCallum, and was educated at St Catherine's School in Melbourne. McCallum graduated from the National Institute of Dramatic Art (NIDA)All Alumni (1960–1969) at nida.com.au in 1969. She is married to writer Roger Davenport. ==Theatre== McCallum is best known for her extensive work in theatre. Notable roles include Portia in The Merchant of Venice, with Alec Guinness as Shylock (Chichester Festival Theatre, dir. Patrick Garland, 1984);http://passiton.cft.org.uk/archive/cast-list-the-merchant-of- venice-1984/ heading a vast cast as Jane Marryot in Noel Coward's Cavalcade (Chichester Festival Theatre, dir. David Gilmore, 1985);http://passiton.cft.org.uk/archive/cast-list-cavalcade-1985/ and Margeurite Blakeney, opposite Donald Sinden as Sir Percy Blakeney, in The Scarlet Pimpernel (Her Majesty’s Theatre, dir. Nicholas Hytner, 1985).http://passiton.cft.org.uk/archive/cast-list-the-scarlet-pimpernel-1985/ She was Meg Page, one of The Merry Wives of Windsor, with Susannah York as Alice Ford (Royal Shakespeare Company, dir. Ian Judge, 1997);http://collections.shakespeare.org.uk/search/rsc- performances/mew199712/view_as/grid/search/everywhere:joanna-mccallum/page/1 and Gertrude, alongside Mark Rylance as Hamlet, at the reconstructed Globe Theatre on London's South Bank (dir. Giles Block, 2000).https://archive.shakespearesglobe.com/CalmView/GetMultimedia.ashx?db=Catalog&type;=default&fname;=5a%5ca6b851-423b-4f0b-9ece-f8ef7b62585e.pdf ==Film and Television== McCallum played the central character, Aroon, in a three part adaptation of Molly Keane's Anglo Irish novel Good Behaviour (BBC Television, dir. Bill Hays, 1983),https://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/024e85e15d3e4a57a81a1b915fa4eee7https://www.bfi.org.uk/films- tv-people/4ce2b7202c7a8 and co-starred with Trevor Eve in A Wreath of Roses, adapted from the book by Elizabeth Taylor (Granada Television, dir. John Madden, 1987).https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b78d5ccb8https://www.latimes.com/archives/la- xpm-1989-01-07-ca-94-story.html In The Franchise Affair, a 1988 BBC Television serial, she played Marion Sharp opposite Rosalie Crutchley and Patrick Malahide.https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b795baa04 She was writer Winifred Holtby in the last episode of Testament of Youth (BBC Television, 1979)https://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/241e495a458e4a47b4ff7e3910e2094b and Virginia Woolf in the film Tom & Viv (1994).https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b7c69c73a McCallum played the missionary Alicia Bassett-Hill in the 1989 TV serial The Ginger Tree, which was based on the novel of the same name by Oswald Wynd; it also starred Samantha Bond and Daisuke Ryu.https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0096595/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 Her other television appearances have included episodes of Holby City,https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1130230/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0602596/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 All Creatures Great and Small,https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0509075/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 and Agatha Christie's Poirot.https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0100216/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 ==Other Activities== Joanna McCallum is currently a Vice President of The Theatrical Guild,http://ttg.org.uk/who-we-are (formerly The Theatrical Ladies Guild), having previously been Chairman, and has worked with the charity for many years. She is also a Vice President of Acting For Others,http://actingforothers.co.uk/involved and is active in fundraising work within the theatre community. == Selected Film and Television Credits == *Doctors, Bleeding Hearts - Margaret Wooley (BBC, 2013)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2613010/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 *Law and Order: UK, Paradise - Judge Hartop (ITV, 2009)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1377082/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 *Holby City, Loss of Faith – Val Hubbard (BBC, 2003) *The Gathering Storm – Marjorie (HBO, 2002)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b87d20f43 *Tom & Viv – Virginia Woolf (dir. Brian Gilbert, 1994) *The House of Eliott - Lady Phylis Crowborough (BBC, 1994)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0101123/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 *Wide-Eyed and Legless - Doctor Roper (dir. Richard Loncraine, 1993)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b7c559f68 *The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes, The Eligible Bachelor – Flora Miller (Granada, 1993)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b7c11148e *A Masculine Ending – Miriam Morris (dir. Antonia Bird, 1992)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0121525/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 *Trainer – Toni Mountford (BBC, 1992)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0101225/fullcredits/?ref_=tt_ov_st_sm *Agatha Christie's Poirot, The Mysterious Affair at Styles – Evelyn Howard (LWT, 1990)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b7a68e0c4 *All Creatures Great and Small, The New World - Lady Hulton (BBC, 1989) *The Ginger Tree – Alicia Bassett-Hill (BBC, 1989) *The Franchise Affair - Marion Sharp (BBC, 1988) *Wreath of Roses - Camilla (Granada, 1987) *A Still Small Shout - Lift Girl (dir. Mike Vardy, 1985)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b77283adf *Coriolanus - Virgilia (BBC, 1984)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b6e2bc550 *Crown Court: Love & War – Hilary Rogers (ITV, 1984)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1152467/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ql_1 *By the Sword Divided - Frances Neville (BBC, 1983)http://www.booksmusicfilmstv.com/Drama/ByTheSwordDivided.htm *Henry VI part 1 - the Countess of Auvergne (BBC, 1983)http://www.screenonline.org.uk/tv/id/527865/credits.html *Bognor - Monica Becket (Thames TV, 1981)https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1286194/?ref_=nm_flmg_act_31 *Hopscotch -bookshop cashier (dir. Ronald Neame, 1980)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b6bde5bfa *Testament of Youth, 1918 - Winifred Holtby (BBC, 1979) *Pygmalion - Clara Eynsford Hill (BBC, 1973)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b7e062dd9 *Barbara of the House of Grebe - Barbara (BBC, 1973)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b6af2158b *Nickel Queen - Jenny (dir. John McCallum, 1971)https://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv- people/4ce2b6b172133 ==Selected Stage Work== *Uncle Vanya - Maria (HOME Theatre Manchester, 2017)https://homemcr.org/production/uncle-vanya-2/ *Hobson's Choice - Mrs Hepworth (Vaudeville Theatre, 2016)http://actdrop.uk/shows/show_listing?show=Hobson*Apostrophe*s%20Choice&id;=2319&theatre;=Vaudeville%20Theatrehttps://www.officialtheatre.com/vaudeville- theatre/hobsons-choice/https://www.londontheatre1.com/reviews/review-of- hobsons-choice-vaudeville-theatre/https://theartsdesk.com/theatre/hobsons- choice-vaudeville-theatrehttps://theatricalia.com/play/4k0/hobsons- choice/production/wn4 *The Importance of Being Earnest - Lady Bracknell (Salisbury Playhouse, 2009)https://www.swindonadvertiser.co.uk/news/4362455.importance-earnest- salisbury-playhouse/ *Habeas Corpus - (Bath Theatre Royal, 2006) *Cymbeline - Queen (Royal Shakespeare Company, 1997)http://collections.shakespeare.org.uk/search/rsc- performances/cym199702/view_as/grid/search/everywhere:joanna-mccallum/page/1 *Twelfth Night - Maria (Royal Shakespeare Company, 1994) *Henry V - Mistress Quickly/Alice (Royal Shakespeare Company, 1994) *Love's Labour's Lost - Princess of France (Bristol Old Vic, 1977)https://bbashakespeare.warwick.ac.uk/productions/loves-labours- lost-1977-bristol-old-vichttps://theatricalia.com/play/15/loves-labours- lost/production/ays *The Caucasian Chalk Circle - Grusha Vachnadze, with Frank Thring as Azdac (Melbourne Theatre Company, 1970)https://www.ausstage.edu.au/pages/event/24282 *Blithe Spirit (play) - Ruth (Thorndike Theatre, 1979) *Saratoga - Virginia Vanderpool (Royal Shakespeare Company, 1978) *The Taming of the Shrew -
